item.title: Postgres Data Types on Rails
item.author: frodsan@me.com (Francesco Rodríguez)
item.description: After watching, @pvh’s talk about PostgreSQL data types, I started looking what default types ActiveRecord uses for PostgreSQL when running a database migration. By default, the ActiveRecord PostgreSQL adapter uses serial for primary keys, timestamp without time zone for datetime/timestamp, and varchar for strings (ref). Based on the suggestions of the talk, You probably want to use bigserial instead of serial, because of the larger amount of serial values (uuids are another option), and always timestamp with time zones.
